meanings.definition: To come before in time or order.
meanings.sent1: The sun preceded the moon in the sky.
meanings.sent2: The teacher always preceded the students into the classroom.
meanings.sent3: The cat playfully preceded the dog in chasing the ball.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter always preceded her entrance into the room.
meanings.sent5: The sound of thunder preceded the rainstorm, warning us of its arrival.

meanings.definition: To go before as a guide.
meanings.sent1: The tour guide preceded the group through the museum.
meanings.sent2: The scout always preceded the troop on their hikes.
meanings.sent3: The map preceded the travelers, showing them the way.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of fresh bread preceded us into the bakery.
meanings.sent5: The chirping birds preceded us on our morning walk, leading the way.

meanings.definition: To be in advance of; have priority over.
meanings.sent1: His urgent message preceded all other notifications on her phone.
meanings.sent2: The urgent task preceded all other tasks on his to-do list.
meanings.sent3: The dessert preceded the main course, much to everyone's surprise.
meanings.sent4: The champion's record-breaking performance preceded all other achievements in the competition.
meanings.sent5: The leader's vision always preceded the team's actions, guiding them towards success.
